functional_evidence.disease_association: Disease-related mutation in Parkinson's disease (PD) as per the introduction.
functional_evidence.assay_type: Quenched hydrogen/deuterium exchange NMR and 2D NMR to study aS aggregation kinetics and structure.
functional_evidence.structural_impact: No changes in amyloid fibril structure (no alteration in conformational stability or secondary structure).
functional_evidence.dynamic_impact: Altered dynamics (residual dynamics) but not structural changes.
functional_evidence.conclusion: Increased pathogenicity is unlikely due to structural changes but may involve other mechanisms (e.g., dynamics).

acmg_steps.rationale: PD is linked to aS aggregation; the study examines how A30P affects this mechanism.
NMR techniques are relevant to studying protein structure and dynamics in aggregates.
The text does not explicitly mention controls (e.g., wild-type vs. mutant comparisons) or replicates.
The method is optimized but not validated against standard techniques or prior studies.
No explicit mention of control variants (benign/pathogenic) used in the assay.
No mention of statistical tests, p-values, or OddsPath calculations.
No data on the number of control variants used in the study.

final_evidence_strength.rationale: The study lacks explicit controls, validation, and statistical analyses required to assign PS3/BS3 strength. The findings suggest structural neutrality but do not meet ACMG criteria for robust functional evidence.

other_variants.E46K: Mentioned in the introduction as a PD-causing mutation but no functional data provided in the text.
other_variants.A53T: Similarly, only referenced as a mutation without functional assay details in the provided text.

notes.methodology: The study focuses on A30P, but the ACMG flowchart requires explicit controls and statistical rigor not fully addressed in the text.
